questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the App Volumes components on the left to their matching function on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
https://techzone.vmware.com/resource/app-volumes-architecture#architecture-overview
App Volumes Manager> ok. Assignement of Packages and Writable volumes
App Volumes Agent> ok. It Runs on a VD or RDSH Server
Writable Volume>It is a container of user installed applications
Application>Its A Collection of packaged version of programs

Answer should be from the top: App Volumes Manager, App Volumes Agent, Application, Writable Volume.
An Application contains packaged version of programs where as a writable volume captures user installed applications.
Yes - last 2 needs to be flip-flopped.

B
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon/2203/horizon-upgrades/GUID-79F50098-CCB3-4688-8732-9832413C6454.html
'If your original servers already have TLS certificates signed by a CA, during the upgrade, VMware Horizon imports your existing CA-signed certificate into the Windows Server certificate store.'

Selected Answer: B
Nothing about this question makes any sense. Where else would a valid certificate be, if not in the windows certificate store? In the apple certificate store?.... In the convience store? When upgrading Horizon it retains the existing certificates. 
I see what PCG1 is referring to in the doc, but again, that statement does not make sense, nor does this question.

choices.A: Installing the Connection Server instance generates a self-signed certificate for the server.
choices.B: The Connection Server installation will automatically extract and import the existing keys and certificates into the Windows Certificate Store.
choices.D: If the import existing certificates checkbox is selected during the Connection Server installation, the existing keys and certificates will be extracted and imported into the Windows Certificate Store.
choices.C: The existing keys and certificates will be extracted and imported into the Windows Certificate Store only if Horizon is integrated with Workspace ONE Access.

questions.question_text: Which of the following will happen when an administrator upgrades the Connection Server and a valid certificate is stored on the Windows Server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer D is correct.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/Unified-Access-Gateway/2207/uag-deploy-config/GUID-F165ECDA-2FD7-4C5A-BA76-2FFB3EFF6921.html

choices.B: Remove the Horizon Connection Server thumbprint in the UAG Admin UI.
choices.D: Enable Quiesce Mode in the UAG Admin UI.

questions.question_text:
An administrator needs to upgrade a Unified Access Gateway (UAG) appliance. The UAG is connected to a load balancer with other UAGs and has existing sessions.
Which option provided allows zero downtime for maintenance?

An administrator needs to submit a network change request to have firewall ports opened to allow users to connect to a Horizon environment using RDP via
Unified Access Gateway with the minimum number of open ports.
Which port selection meets the requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
TCP 443 only needed. It tunnels RDP.
See
https://techzone.vmware.com/resource/network-ports-vmware-horizon#external-connection
I personally tested this and you only need 443 open to use RDP when going through the UAG. Answer is D

comments.content: The question EXPLICITLY asks for RDP.

discussion.content: Answer D. If Blast Extreme is the only display protocol used, the PCoIP and RDP ports need not be opened

It looks HTTPS is enough, so answer is D
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/horizon-architecture-planning/GUID-ECDCEC31-7621-4C05-ACA3-52E7BA23F876.html

choices.C: The Import/Export Config can be deleted from a user profile.
choices.B: It allows backup of the user profile.
choices.A: The Microsoft Windows users profile configuration can be changed.
choices.D: The registry or filesystem paths do not have to be typed in the editor.

questions.question_text:
What is the benefit of using the Browse Local Profile feature in the Dynamic Environment Manager to adjust the Import/Export configuration for an application
DirectFlex?
